name: Wagner, Appellant, v. International Brotherhood of Electricians, Local No. 1305
name_abbreviation: Wagner v. International Brotherhood of Electricians

judges: Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and McBride, JJ.
parties: Wagner, Appellant, v. International Brotherhood of Electricians, Local No. 1305.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The decree of the court below dismissing the plaintiff’s complaint without prejudice is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Cercone, reported at 16 Pa. D. & C. 2d 489; the appellant for costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Harry Alan Sherman, for plaintiff, appellant.
Richard R. Lyma,n, with him Loyal H. Gregg, and Gregg and Price, and Mulholland, Robie & Hickey, fox-defendant, union, appellee.
James R. Orr, with him Reed, Smith, Shaw & Mc-Glay, for defendant, railx-oad, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:

Argued March 19, 1959.
Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and McBride, JJ.
Harry Alan Sherman, for plaintiff, appellant.
Richard R. Lyma,n, with him Loyal H. Gregg, and Gregg and Price, and Mulholland, Robie & Hickey, fox-defendant, union, appellee.

April 20, 1959:
